content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 6 to node 5 is:

7->6->11

To see why, consider the steps of this path:

* Start at node 7, which is an edge of the graph
* Then go to node 6
* Then go to node 11, which is a destination for two paths in the graph

If you take these steps, you will end up at node 5, and you have achieved your goal of reaching the target node in the shortest possible number of steps. Note that this is indeed the shortest path because it does not involve any nodes that are not on the shortest path.

The shortest path from node 6 to node 6 is a single step:

6->6

Because node 6 is already the destination node, there is no need to take any additional steps to reach it. Therefore, the shortest path is simply the single step of going directly from the starting node to the destination node.
